solution_line_template: The total bill before taxes or gratuities was ${steak_cost} for the steak + ${wine_cost} for the wine = ${steak_cost}+${wine_cost} = $<<{steak_cost}+{wine_cost}={bill_before_tax_gratuity}>>{bill_before_tax_gratuity}

If the tax is {sales_tax_percent}%, then the taxes paid were ${bill_before_tax_gratuity} * {sales_tax_percent}% = $<<{bill_before_tax_gratuity}*{sales_tax_percent}*{percent_to_decimal_factor}={taxes_paid}>>{taxes_paid}
That means that the total bill before gratuities was ${bill_before_tax_gratuity} + ${taxes_paid} = $<<{bill_before_tax_gratuity}+{taxes_paid}={bill_before_gratuities}>>{bill_before_gratuities}
If the final bill was ${final_bill}, then you were charged ${final_bill}-${bill_before_gratuities} = $<<{final_bill}-{bill_before_gratuities}={gratuities_charged}>>{gratuities_charged} for gratuities
